results.text: You are an expert at keeping your feet, even on the most unstable ground. Until you complete a long rest you cannot be knocked prone as a result of terrain-based hazards.

Your ability to deftly avoid your enemies is almost supernatural. You gain an expertise die on the next check you make to Tumble past an enemy creature. If you already have an expertise die to the check from the tumble specialty, increase it to 1d8.
You are able to squeeze through even the most narrow of passageways. You ignore the movement penalty normally imposed by squeezing through a space one size smaller than yourself.
Youâ€™re a master of escaping even the tightest of bonds. You have advantage on your next Dexterity check or saving throw to avoid or escape a grapple.
You are extra quick on your feet, helping you avoid danger. You may add a [[/r 1d4]] bonus to your AC to the next attack that would hit you (this requires no action, as in the parry weapon property).

You know just how to land to reduce the damage caused by a fall. When you would take fall damage, reduce the amount of damage taken by a number equal to twice your proficiency bonus. This bonus lasts until you complete a long rest.
